Summary Heading: They do not let you cancel
Summary: I was told I would have 24 hours notice to make a cancelation, I called 3 weeks before my reservation and they said they would not refund me now. Terrible experience. I highly recommend staying at anywhere else.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean room and comfortable beds . Value for your money
Summary: Great hotel and comfortable beds! Nice and pleasant check in . Woman at front desk was very nice and friendly. Walking distance to a place called hideout pizza which was very good . The room was spacious . It was very clean . Tv was a little small but a clean room and comfortable beds .
Room tip: Parking spaces are small so if you are able bring a compact car .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms are spacious and beds were comfortable. Rooms were clean.  Check in staff was friendly.  About $8 to $9 for an uber to Disneyland.  Got great value for money. Has fridge and microwave and free breakfast. I booked thru priceline.com      for price breakers and saved alot of money. At first was worried but glad I got this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The place was very clean the rooms were excellent and clean beds were comfortable the staff were very friendly. Would recommend others to stay here definitely will be back again when I’m in the country
Manager Response: none

Summary: Firstly we booked here purely to visit Disneyland. The walk is pretty long, so we ended up getting Ubers (about $6USD each way) which was fine and there were plenty around. It was definitely more than $6 cheaper than the other closer Disneyland accommodation so that is a win right there.  The rooms were nice and spacious, however the floors were very dirty. The wooden floorboards looked nice and clean, but if you walk around in socks for 5 minutes you will quickly realise they are not. TV has plenty of channels with good quality signal and they bathrooms were of a good size. There is also a couple of vending machines with snacks and cold drinks if you needed that.  Things to consider when staying here: 1. Very loud! If you are on the bottom 2 floors than expect to hear loud
Room tip: Top floor would be the quietest - hopefully you won't hear footsteps!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed at many other Quality Inns in other areas but this one....well, let's start with the positive. The location is good for Disneyland, if you aren't walking, as it's about 1-2 miles from Main Gate or from the Mickey & Friends/Pixar Parking Garages. The bed was comfortable. The room was of decent size (King room) and clean. The AC was a tad noisy but worked well, didn't keep us awake. We were on the third floor and could walk down the balcony "hall" to watch the 9:30 fireworks (aerials only) from Disneyland. There is an elevator and a couple of luggage carts. They have a pool but it is small and right next to the parking lot.   The negatives: I couldn't get the wifi to run on my laptop, though my phone picked it up just fine. The breakfast was not very "deluxe", as they
Room tip: on third floor you can see the fireworks from Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Quality Inn’s website and outside signage offer a Deluxe Breakfast however the breakfast is by far no deluxe. Very poor quality of prepared food. Room was clean and spacious. A/C very noisy and fan in bathroom barely worked. Due to fan not working properly the room would get very humid after a shower. No shuttle to Disneyland. The hotel was located in a run down part of town however was only a few miles from Disneyland. It was a great place to see fireworks from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  We regret that we were not able to meet all your expectations.  We will try harder.  We would love it if you would give us another opportunity to win back your business.

Summary Heading: Extremely overpriced, and sneaky about it
Summary: To start, let me say that the beds are very soft and comfortable. Now for the rest. When I booked this place, it was because it was a good price in an area close to a concert I was attending. Except it wasn't a good price. It looked like it was, until I got there and they informed me of a "resort fee" that never once showed up in any description while I was booking. When I went and scoured their website, I finally found it, but it was not easy. The one I did find was $10. This does not explain why I was charged $11.50, of course. As for the fee, what's it for? Who knows. This is not a resort, offers nothing more than basic accommodations, and those are thin at best. Very basic breakfast, miniscule pool, no hot tub...all basics expected of any Quality Inn as part of their nightly
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  We charge a resort fee because we are considered to be in the Disneyland Resort Area.  It is charged so our guests can take advantage of the ART shuttles at a discounted rate.  We are sorry you feel that way and if you do decide to stay with us in the future we will gladly refund that fee for you.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for a Disney family trip. I checked in late and ALFRED at the front desk was AWESOME... I was very tired after a long drive and Alfred was helpful and answered all of my questions regarding the property and nearby attractions. The room was clean,lots of space, refrigerator and microwave worked perfect. Continental breakfast was GREAT!!! waffles, biscuits and gravy, eggs variety of juices, coffee, cereal, different kinds of bread, skim milk, 2% milk. Overall awesome place to stay, friendly staff,awesome food, very close to Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  I will let Alfred know about your kind words about him.  We are very proud of all our team members and it makes us feel good when others notice too.  We hope to see you again real soon.

Summary Heading: Not what we expected. Rough area, low end motel.
Summary: I don’t know where these people come up with all the great reviews. Fooled me. For $90 it should have been nicer. It is what you would expect for maybe $50. You obviously are paying for being within walking distance of the main gate to Disneyland. You have to be in decent shape and committed. It is close to a mile. The neighborhood declines quickly after crossing the freeway. Didn’t get harassed or mugged, but not comfortable. The motel borders a school, houses and a convalescent home. Right by a liquor store too. Very strange location.  The motel is “renovated” but obviously old and worn. There was some labor strike going on which was awkward. The staff that is working seemed very friendly and no issue there. The pool is tiny. Room stinks. I don’t know what the smell was but
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  We apologize that you did not enjoy your stay with us.  Our hotel is located in a residential area but it is very safe.  As for the strike, it had nothing to do with our employees - our ownership is building another hotel and the Union has an issue with a sub-contractor they are using.  And yes, our staff is very friendly and we appreciate everything they do for us.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to win back your business in the future.

Summary: Easy check-in. Room was very comfortable, but finding a plug for my laptop at the desk that is connected to the dresser was interesting (you have to get on your knees and find it behind the desk). Internet was very good. Breakfast area was nice and the waffles were to die for :) TV had plenty of choices. Very close to Disneyland, so expect to see a lot of people with Mickey Mouse ears! The bathroom was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. I noticed other rooms being remodeled. Sufficient free parking onsite.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  As for the outlets, we have just started our renovation of the property and our new furniture will have more than enough outlets in additional to USB outlets.  We hope you can come stay with us once that is done.

Summary: Husband woke up with one on his head the size of a lady bug. Pulled back the mattress, they were everywhere. It was an extremely upsetting experience, it still is. We pray we don't bring them home. On-site manger made staff deal with us and was supposed to get a claim form but never did. We are disappointed with the lack of concern from the manager.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review.  We are sorry for what happened to you while you stayed with us.  We inspect our rooms contantly and this is not something that happens at our hotel.  I was called away from the hotel for an emergency and was not able to talk to you the day of your departure and I apologize for that.  We hope you wll give us another opportunity to win back your business.  I would like to offer you a free night stay at our hotel the next time you are in the area to make up for the inconveinence.

Summary Heading: Lots of Problems - You Can Do Better
Summary: This is just an average hotel which might be OK at a reasonable price - the cost was jacked way up for a big conference weekend and this place is not worth it. The rooms are average - we had problems with the toilet leaking when we arrived, which they did fix after a night of it filling every 10 minutes.   THE POOL was completely unacceptable - I wouldn't even stick my feet in it. I asked and they said they would get it cleaned...never happened. That is a pretty big bummer for a California hotel....  Walls are thin as is the ceiling...you can hear every footstep above and when someone shower it is very loud in your room.  Finally, the bathroom light was on a delay and wouldn't shut off for over 30 minutes.  Just a way overpriced hotel with a pool that is unusable!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey.  We are sorry that we were not able to meet your expectations.  I will share your feedback with our staff.  I hope you will give us another opportunity in the future to win back your business.

Summary: We stayed in Room 111.  Great property!  Not luxury but great price, clean, big, very comfortable beds, bathrooms were clean with ample towels.  No bugs (that I saw).  Walkable distance to Disneyland or uber there for like $7 bucks.  Husband and I walked home from Disneyland at 11:30 PM at night without issue, but it will take about 25-30 minutes walk.  You can save money on the parking. I really enjoyed my stay here.  Would definitely recommend.  Free parking, free breakfast, and free wifi that was fast for me.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to fill out our survey.  We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  I also wanted to let you know we will be starting our renovations on the property next month.  Hope you can come stay with us once that is complete.

Summary: Staff was nice and helpful.  Room was very nice for the price.  Clean and cool with refrigerator and microwave. We stayed near registration end which was close to street. A little noisy at night. Continental breakfast was a surprise with waffles, eggs, yogurt, pastries and fruit
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out our survey.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  We look forward to seeinf you again in the future.

Summary: Cockroaches greeted us every morning for three days in a row.. One was dead in this picture another was alive and my hubby had to step on it.. I was terrified we slept with towels on the bottom of the door because you could see light and I just knew they were in the room. I also thought the front staff was not friendly and breakfast was horrible. I am shocked that no one has taken care of the roach problem. One night we were awoken by new customers who getting in late and they were screaming about the cockroaches..don't stay here. I have to admit I am surprised because I have never seen this before at a choice hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was great! The room we had was renovated, minus the carpet.  The room was clean and the beds were pretty good. The breakfast could have been better but it was FREE!! We could see the nightly fireworks from our room on the third floor. The walk to Disneyland was about 20 minutes and the bus ride is easy for end of the day! The pizza place (The Hideout)  down the street is great and affordable! Overall, it is good for people who aren't spending a lot of time in the room. It was great for the money ($80 a night), we would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very old hotel that caters to low class clientele.  Being near Disneyland, this hotel is a fly trap to families who cannot afford something nicer.  There were children running around all hours of the night and day and the hotel staff did nothing to keep them quiet.  Our first night there we had a family above us with small children who kept running around the room and because of the noise we assume they were jumping off the furniture.  We complained to the hotel staff and nothing was done to stop this.  It continued until well after 11 PM and night.  The second night we were there, we had a family with small children next door to us and it was apparent from what we saw, they were there with other families who also had small children.  They were kept there doors open and the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review.  We are extremely sorry for the experience you had at our hotel.  This is not something normal.  I am also suprised our staff did not address the issue immediately.  W hope you will give us another chance in the future to win back your business.

Summary: Hotel was clean and comfortable. It looked to be recently renovated. It is quite a trek from the entrance of Disneyland so I would highly recommend getting tickets for the shuttle. These can be purchased at the front desk.  The beds were great! Comfy and cozy after a long day of lines and people. The breakfast, however, was something to be desired. It did boast of eggs and waffles but the typical “free breakfast” fair was more prominent and still lacking. Please be aware that if traveling with a little one they only have one high chair for the breakfast hour.  Other than that I would probably stay again as the rates were quite affordable for the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review.  Your feedback is very important to us and we will be sharing it with our staff.  Thank you for letting us know about the highchair - we will make sure there are more in the future,  We hope to see you again very soon.

Summary Heading: A short bus ride to the park they say a short walk but NOT! Very clean! Nice accommodating staff.
Summary: You could walk to the park. After 20 minutes you would get there. Or take the ART bus and get there in five minutes. Two dollars adult one dollar child  or get a day pass. This way you can come and go but we found we just stayed at the park all day And evening. On the way back you catch the number 10 and return to the hotel. It is a longer ride. it takes you around the neighborhood. It is worth it. at the end of the day After walking around the park all day it’s nice to be able to sit down and just enjoy the ride and hear the people talking about their fun day.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us such a great review.  I love your insight about listening to the others on the bus about their experiences.  Your feedback is very important to us and we will be sharing it with our staff.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Charged for a Disney vacation that won't happen.
Summary: We finally planned and reserved our first ever family Disney vacation and we decided to stay here. I thought I was cost effective by prepaying for the hotel room, gaining a discount. Big Mistake!  Our kids are young adults and one of the girls is on a college softball scholarship. Her school added a game for the same time we were planned to be at Disneyland, so our trip is now cancelled. When I called the hotel to cancel, they refused to refund me my reservation. I'm out almost 800.00 for a family vacation I won't even take.
Manager Response: Sorry for the inconvenience.  If you don't mind can you send me the information for your reservation to me directly and i'll see what I can do.  My name is Mukesh and I am the Operations Manager for the hotel.  My email address is opsmanager@nmghotels.net.  Thank you.

Summary: Super Happy with the Hotel.  Very Friendly front desk staff.  Nice Breakfast.  Safe location.  Clean rooms, Nice Lobby and breakfast area.  Comfy beds.   Just 2 buildings down for bus stop to Disney.  We will for sure stay here again on our next trip to Anaheim/Disney!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the great review you wrote us.  We really appreciate your feedback and look forward to seeing you again in the near future.

Summary: Stayed in this 2 nights and were very satisfied from the cleanliness of the room to the breakfast. Although it is an older style outside entrance motel, the rooms have been upgraded and modernised. The rooms and lobby are clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.

Summary: The staff was very friendly. Price is affordable. The parking is tight. It is very close to all amenities, Disneyland. Room is okay. Breakfast area is very tight. The room walls are very thin and you can hear everything going on outside. shuttle bus service to disney
Manager Response: Thank you very much for writing us such a good review.  We value your feedback and will be sharing it with our staff.  We look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary: Before going into detail, let me first say that this hotel was recommended by a family member. It did not come even close to living up to that recommendation! Second, the sign says "Newly Renovated." At no stretch of the imagination has this hotel been renovated! If what we experienced is AFTER being renovated, I would hate to see the "before" condition! Now the details...  1. The reservation/check-in: Our reservation (made on-line) was for an accessible room. On check-in we were told that is not what we reserved. We told them we needed an accessible shower (as the individual was in a walker and could not step over a tub). We were told there was nothing available. I attempted to show him the printed receipt, showing the request for an accessible room; he would not look at it,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review.  We apologize for all the issues that arose during your stay.  We will take every one of these items and look into them.  We would also like the opportunity to win your business back.  Your feedback is very important to us.

Summary: Thru booking .com I was able to obtain a great price for this place.  It very close to Disneyland, family orientated, good breakfast selection, parking was not so great, rooms were very clean.  Rooms came with microwave and mini fridge.  Pool was very clean and open.  Staff was very efficient, hospitable, professional and knowledgeable.   I truly enjoyed my stay here and felt it was well worth the money.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us such a great review.  We value your feedback and will be forwarding this to our staff.  We look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Quality Inn Has Improved with Quality!
Summary: It's been quite a long time since I've stayed at a Quality Inn because for a while I found the price was not comparable to the quality stay I would expect. I'm not sure what happened but there were great changes made and I will start staying here again!  Check in was fast and extremely friendly. Price was very close to what I payed for a Hilton brand a weekend previously but no where near as great a stay. Room 216 was very comfortable. The beds are absolutely perfect. They're also very clean and super cozy. Pillows were great too. The towels were plentiful and fresh. Shampoo, conditioner and soaps were filled. No need for slippers or flip flops because the carpet was very clean.  There is a pool that is small but very clean.  Very little noise could be heard from neighbors.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Yes Its true , We have been improving.  Our guest have spoken and we have listened. We have added a beautiful exterior patio so that our guest have access to  morning until night with plenty of room to have breakfast and and joy our great Southern California Weather. We have also completely renovated our  guest bathrooms that add a sleek fresh look. We thank you for noticing and we can't wait for you to come back and see what other positive changes we have made.

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our trip to Disney.  Within walking distance to the Magic Kingdom and several restaurants this hotel made our trip that much more enjoyable.  From the complimentary hot breakfast, pool and gift shop every staff member was friendly and helpful.  The easy access from the freeway was also a plus.  We have stayed at this hotel a total of three times and every time was a winner.
Manager Response: Dear Jo Ann,   Thank you for your wonderful review.  I'm glad you found our hotel to be walking distance to Disney and I'm glad that you have chosen to stay with us 3 times so far. Cant wait to see you here again next time your out here.  From all of us here at the Quality Inn Anaheim Resort we thank you for your visits.

Summary: This location is not near the main gate. There is a closer Quality Inn closer to the main gate of Disney. It's a bit of a walk and it's not the nicest of neighborhoods. Parking is a disaster even though they do a courtesy valet as there apparently are more rooms than parking spots. We parked and used Uber to get to and from Disney. It was about $5-$6 a trip. Easier and cheaper then parking at Disney. You also have to pay a resort fee here as well. Apparently because it's in proximity to Disney and it's California and this state lives for all kinds of creative fees. Also the free breakfast is below average compared to other complimentary breakfasts at other hotel chains. Overall this hotel is in dire need of a refresh.
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest,  We do apologies for failing to meet your expectations.  We will be using this feedback to make to ensure we communicate these types of situations differently in the future. Thank you once again and we hope we get another opportunity to provide you with great service.

Summary: I was completely satisfied with the 3 night stay here for our Disneyland trip. The hotel is conveniently located 1.2 mi to the park. It is walkable for some but I preferred to take Uber with small kids. There is also ART shuttle stop around 500ft of the hotel.  The hotel was clean with large enough rooms with microwave and refrigerator which is a must for us. The beds were comfortable for a good night sleep after tiring days at the park. The staff is very cordial and friendly. The breakfast is just like any other place with waffle, scrambled eggs, assorted muffins, pastries among other things. The place offers free parking though the lot is small. I personally didn't had any issue with the parking.  We could see the spectacular Disney fireworks right from our room on third
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time and writing us a review! We are so pleased to hear that you  enjoyed your stay with us and that we were able to make your stay with us a memorable one. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: A bit of a walk from Disneyland, but not a particular effort.   Any further may be a bit far on foot.  Anyway, there is an advertised shuttle bus.  It really is a nice hotel, well priced and with friendly and helpful staff.  My hotel of choice in Anaheim, especially since my previous one changed hands.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time and writing us a review! We are so pleased to hear that we are your choice hotel. See you back soon.

Summary: It would be a long long walk. Older hotel, park in front if door. Parking free but sparse if you come back late. Comfortable beds, large clean rooms, microwave/fridge, small outdoor pool, there is an elevator.  At about 9:30pm every night you can view the Disneyland fireworks display. Best view upstairs.  Breakfast area poorly set up, only one waffle maker, people waiting in line for that block everyone else from eggs, biscuits & gravy. Not enough seating. They do strive to keep food refilled.  If you book online, there is a surprise charge that doesn't show up until after you have booked room & they have your credit card. They will tell you it is a resort fee that the city of Anaheim mandates them to collect.   Nevertheless, it was good enough value that we stayed here twice.
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest,  We do apologies for failing to meet your expectations.  We will be using this feedback to make to ensure we handle these types of situations differently in the future.   Thank you once again and we hope we get another opportunity to provide you with great service. We hope to see you back for a third time.

Summary: The hotel room was great, the staff was nice. I did not like the parking lot arrangement. The parking spaces seemed too small and the turning radius was very minimal. I witnessed a normal size truck adjusting several times before they were settled. Cars were double parked due to lack of space, leaving no room for other guests. There is no way out at the end of the parking lot, had to reverse to get to the front. But all in all, the stay was great and it is not within walking distance of the park.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time and sharing your feedback with us. I do apologize about the parking but you will be glad to hear that on our high occupancy nights we now offer A Free Valet Service to all our guest! We hope you will be able to join us soon so that you are able enjoy this new experience for our guest!

Summary: My family and I have been staying here for many years. It is by far the most comfortable, clean place with very friendly staff. The prices are very reasonable considering how close it is to Disneyland. They offer a hot breakfast every morning with a variety of pastries as well. And who doesn't like looking out their window to a firework show! This will definitely be our Choice Hotel for all our future trips to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time in provide feedback about your previous stay, we are happy to see you enjoyed your stay with us and that you will be back. We thank you for your loyalty and we look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary: Great experience this week!! We had such great service at the front desk with lots of random request including a sewing kit!  The room had A 2 person jetted tub which was perfect After walking Disneyland! Only complaint was the low shower head location. Made me bend ackwardly to shampoo.  The breakfast was great and always stocked. A little more variety would be awesome!! Thanks again for a great stay 👍🏼 Heidi
Manager Response: Dear Heidi,   We are so happy the you enjoyed your stay here with us and that you were able to take advantage of our jetted tubs. We are always looking into way to improve our services and we will take your suggestions in considerations.  Once again thank you for your great review and we home to see you back soon.

Summary: This hotel is not walking distance to Disneyland or close to the Maingate. Complimentary breakfast was bland, cold and there weren't many options. The breakfast area was very small and cramped. Beds were not comfortable and they sagged. Room was clean and but it looked out dated.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel and staff. As a team we strive to give our guests the best customer service as possible, so it is nice to see that it is paying off. We look forward to seeing you again on y our next visit to this area.

Summary Heading: Great stay for our Disneyland trip
Summary: My family stayed here for two nights while we were on a quick trip to Disneyland a few days before Christmas. Our room was really big, clean, comfortable. The hotel had a continental breakfast which was perfectly adequate. It's located just very a short walk away from a bus stop where you can catch the shuttle to Disneyland. You can buy tickets for the shuttle at the front desk. We were told that you can see the Disney fireworks from the hotel (unfortunately the fireworks were cancelled both nights due to weather. boo!) Staff was friendly, we had no problems whatsoever. I really have no complaints except I wish the WiFi was faster, but that's not really a deal breaker for us.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel and staff. As a team we strive to give our guests the best customer service as possible, so it is nice to see that it is paying off. We look forward to seeing you again on y our next visit to this area.

Summary Heading: Good quiet Hotel for Disney Land vacation
Summary: Front desk agent who checked us in was very friendly and got us checked in quickly and gave us all the information we needed.  Front desk agent working all three mornings we stayed was very nice and helpful as well.  She seemed genuinely excited to help us in the morning with bus passes and any info we needed.  Night agent on Tuesday night wasn't dressed as well as other agents and acted annoyed that I came in to ask for my key to he redone.  Breakfast was good but not very many choices.  Breakfast attendant was friendly and helpful.  Room was clean and quiet some small appearance issues that maintenance should address but nothing that negatively impacted my stay.  Overall hotel was great and provided me with everything I needed and most importantly three great nights of sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kinds words regarding your stay at our property. Our staff works very hard to provide the best customer service possible to all of our guests. I will be sure to speak with the staff you encountered on Tuesday night, to ensure we are all dressed professionally and ready to assist all of our guests in a positive and helpful manner. I have also spoken with my Head Maintenance man to ensure that any and all issues are addressed in each room in a timely manner.

Summary: Had a very good night sleep, room was very clean and services was great. Wish that they had more than just one waffle maker though. The bed and pillow was very comfortable. Very kid friendly. We stayed there for over trip to Disneyland. The kids enjoy there stay as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel and staff. As a team we strive to give our guests the best customer service as possible, so it is nice to see that it is paying off. We look forward to seeing you again on y our next visit to this area.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: The pros to this hotel:  1. Newly renovated rooms 2. Attractive decor in the rooms 3. Large rooms with sofa  4. Elevator in motel 5. Pool 6. Inexpensive 7. Close to Disneyland 8. Clean and well maintained 9. Free breakfast 10. Friendly staff  Cons:  1. The breakfast room is very small, needs more tables and a larger room  I would stay again
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel and staff. As a team we strive to give our guests the best customer service as possible. We are in the process of creating more seating areas for our guests in the breakfast area. We look forward to seeing you again on y our next visit to this area.

Summary: We arrived a bit early @ 2 and while room wasn't ready , I was given a parking pass and a coupon for a local restaurant . The Hotel room itself was ok , clean, comfortable beds . Mini Fridge and Microwave were a great benefit to have. Only issue was parking, Very difficult after a long day at the parks. We left earlier than we wanted due to lack of parking and worried we would not get a spot . IF you are interested in watching , hearing and Feeling the Fireworks it is good for that , but keep in mind they are really , really loud, but not the motels fault and my Granddaughter loved it . Not sure I would consider this Motel within walking distance ,at least not after a full day at Disney, but it is pretty close. The Motel was on bus line and ART is near. Breakfast was as
Manager Response: Well thank you for your review and I'm glad that your granddaughter enjoyed the Fire work show! We have a great view too!. Sorry that your room was not ready, my housekeeping team works really hard in trying to push out those rooms as fast as we can. Next time give us a call earlier and we will put a rush on that room for you.

Summary: Although we just got here, I am very happy with the cleanliness and size of our room, and it was inexpensive. Two most imporant things were checked: the shower looks impeccably clean and the beds are way comfortable. Even though it is far walk from the park, there is a cheap shuttle to Disneyland from here as well that runs before Disneyland opens and 30 min after it closes.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are always working hard as a team to provide the best service possible to all of our guests. This makes me so happy to know that everyone is doing what a great job. We hope you enjoy your stay with us and if you ever need anything please let us know.

Summary: I liked this place.  Not too far from Disneyland.   Unfortunately no hotel shuttle, but about a 20 minute walk, so not that far, given that if one is going to Disneyland, one is going to be doing a whole lot more walking.   The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room large, well furnished and clean.   I think this will be my hotel of choice in future, in this area.    Breakfast was nothing to get excited about, but there was fruit which was nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel and staff. As a team we strive to give our guests the best customer service as possible, so it is nice to see that it is paying off. We look forward to seeing you again on y our next visit to this area.

Summary Heading: My New Go to Spot in Orange County

Minor annoyances, overall, but worth mentioning, in case ownership reads these.  Lastly, it's important to note that it's probably a mile to the Maingate - not walkable, if you have kids. I finally told Cindy the manager that unless she called me back in 1 business day with a tracking number I was going to tell the story.  So beware traveler.  This hotel is not only sub-par (the food was atrocious) but the staff is dishonest and petty.

We stayed at this hotel because of price and it was close to Disneyland park. (At the front desk they sell A.R.T. (Anahiem Resort Transit) tickets for the bus to Disneyland park. It's cheaper to buy from the hotel than on the bus. It gives you a day pass.) If your looking for the a decent room on a budget, this place is a good place. If your looking for chocolates on your pillow, and fluffy robes...... You better bring your own. I would stay again. The employees were friendly and the a/c was cold.

Over all the property location was great; we were visiting Knotts Berry farm, it was clean and spacious. The breakfast was fine too; no major complaints, except for at least two of the employees, the female in the AM and the male in the PM. Upon entering the lobby I wished both of them the time of the day and none responded to me. Other that that everything was fine. I will stay here again in the future. Another plus for Choice

Summary Heading: Budget is the main thing here!

When you arrive there is a $5.75 resort fee which is reasonable. The wifi will not work with Apple devices, but will work on a laptop at very, very slow speeds.    The rooms look like they need an upgrade. The TV was a small 19" flat screen and not like other budget hotels in the area. The bathrooms are older but have been redone. The breakfast was similar to other Quality Inns and quite sufficient.I am diabetic ,but made my oatmeal in our room and had the eggs and fruit served in the lobby. We are very happy that you continue to stay with us whenever you are going to Disneyland and looking forward to seeing you again very soon !

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for a Disneyland visit.
Summary: My wife and I, along with our four children spent six nights at the Quality Inn & Suites Maingate the week of June 21st through the 27th.  Pros:  Very friendly staff who'll probably bend over backwards to make your stay pleasant, about 3/4 of a mile from Disneyland, clean, comfortable, and recently refurbished rooms, and a great view of the Disneyland fireworks each night (assuming you're not in the park), nice breakfast (although the breakfast nook is relatively small).  Cons: VERY tight parking (will discuss below), fees that aren't disclosed on the hotel's website (example:  they charge a $5.75 a night "resort" fee).    Overall, we had a good time staying here.  As I pointed out, the staff was very friendly and helpful.  If we needed towels, they brought us extras.  Good
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review, we appreciate it immensely. We learn from all of our guests from these reviews what we are doing right and what we need to improve upon. We take all of our guests reviews seriously and all team members and Managers review them daily. We thank you for letting us know how impressed you were with our staff. They are the BEST of the BEST. We look forward to seeing you again soon !

Summary Heading: The two night stay at Quality Inn & Suites Maingate!
Summary: We arrive around 8 p.m. To Anaheim, California.  We happened to notice Quality Inn & Suites Maingate. There was a man at the front desk. I did not think to get his name. He was very nice and very helpful. We were so happy we were able to get a room here. We had a problem with the safe in the room.  The man at the front desk sent two nice maintenance men to assist us with the safe in the room. The man at the front desk called our room. To check on us, to make sure the problem with the safe was fixed. The two mornings we were there. Ruby was very helpful. She answered all of our questions. It makes a difference when people care.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for such high scores, we really appreciate you as a guest and your wonderful comments about our staff, especially Ruby. She is an experienced professional who goes above and beyond for all our guests , as does all of our team members. We look forward to seeing you again soon !

Summary: Pro;  Large clean and comfortable rooms. Front Desk Staff friendly. 1 mile walk to Disney parks. Con: I would NOT expect a charge to use the computer in the lobby at a QI. (min charge $3.50). $5.00 parking charge. Very small swimming pool without any lounging chairs around the pool.  Breakfast is your typical breakfast found at any Quality Inn. Waffles, bisquits and gravey, muffins etc. only room for about 12 people in the breakfast room  Once again the nickel and diming charges at this hotel might make me think twice about returning. I have stayed in many choice hotels and never have I seen a charge for for the "business center" But if you are just looking for a clean and comfortable room you won't go wrong staying here.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest Thank you for taking the time to submit a review. We greatly appreciate all of your comments. It lets us know what we are doing right, and the areas that we can improve upon. We hope to see you again soon !  Penny Front Office Manager 714 991 8100

Summary: Stayed in the 2 queen bed and 1 sofa bed room. It was lovely and spacious, and everyone had ample room. My boyfriend has some issues showering, since he's 6'3" the shower head was located a little low, but it was fine for two nights. There was a continental breakfast in the morning and plenty of late night bites for us night owls to eat within walking distance to here too (a small pizza place two buildings over that had more than just pizza, a lovely surprise!). We walked to Disneyland the second day of our stay and it was a nice quick walk. With the parking being cheaper for two nights at the hotel than for one day at Disneyland, it was ideal, but park further in the pack because the lot is a bit cramped.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, We appreciate your kind words about your stay. Thank you for taking the time. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This a great place to stay only ten minutes from Disney Ruby was very helpfull to us she even sold us the bus tickets so that we wouldn't have to take our car and save us a lot of hassle veryclean and quiet I will stay here again and we recommend to friends.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for you kind words regarding our ROCKSTAR employee, Ruby. We are glad you had a wonderful stay and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Double queen spacious for our family, very Clean, after check in front desk called to make sure everything was ok. Breakfast was great kids enjoyed waffles only suggest to put in another waffle maker and more tables and chairs. Clerks were extremely profession. When we checked out and my husband forgot his licence at the desk, the clerk ran behind us almost 2 blocks away to return it.. they are great. And most definitely will stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your kind words about our staff. Going above and beyond for our Guests is what we do best and Ruby was exceptional at catching up with you when you left you D/L behind. We appreciate you recognizing her efforts. Very kind of you indeed. We look forward to you visiting with us again soon.

Summary: We got the 3 bed queen room. Very spacious, clean and comfortable. The room needed more lighting and the ac does not cool the far bed very well because of the divider wall. Breakfast was good. No free shuttle to Disneyland as advertised. Staff friendly. Parking was difficult, when you come in later all the spots are full. Luckily they let us park in the reservation parking. The toilet did not flush on the very first use the brought a plunger up right away.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. We are glad that our staff could look after you  and were friendly. The Public Shuttle (ART) information on our website does let guests know there is one for a nominal cost, which is $5 plus tax. We have  tickets available at the Front Desk for the shuttle for guests convenience. Thank you again for staying with us. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We stayed 4 nights in a double queen room.  The room was spacious and comfortable for our family.  The check in experience was fast and pleasant.  The front desk called our room after check in to make sure the room was to our satisfaction.  The continental breakfast was a great bonus, the kids loved the waffle maker.  My only suggestion is to either add a ventilation system to the bathroom or allow the rear window to open.  The room became stuffy after showering.  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out a review in regards to your stay with us. We are so thrilled you enjoyed your stay and that you will return. Thanks so much for your positive feedback on our staff and breakfast. We already fixed the back window for room extra ventilation.  I look forward to seeing you again and hope you have the 5 star experience next time!

Summary: We were in the area on business & arrived late in the evening - after 9pm. The 1st room had bugs in the tub and a musty smell. Rooms are definitely spacious. So we asked to see a different room. The 2nd room had the same issue. So we returned to the front desk and let them know we weren't going to stay and to cancel the reservation.  We were told it was made after the cancelation time and was therefore non cancelable. We contacted customer service. I spoke to the front desk mgr in the a.m. and she didn't see anything charged. If all else fails we'll contact the credit card company.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: I was on a business trip not going to Disneyland, but even if you are going there it's only a few blocks away.  I could see the nightly Disney fireworks from my room.  The room was very spacious, super clean and comfortable.  The staff were very helpful and aside from the Disney fireworks it was very quiet.  The microwave and mid-size fridge in the room were super and the price was great too!  I would definitely stay here again.  -John
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review in regards to your stay here. We are so thrilled you enjoyed your stay and that you will return. Thanks so much for your positive feedback on our staff and rooms. I hope you like the pictures I have taken for you with our Mickey Mouse in the lobby. I look forward to seeing you again and hope you have the same 5 star experience!

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for us while visiting Disneyland
Summary: I took my daughter and her family to Disneyland.  We had the room with 3 queen beds.  The room was big, clean, and perfect for our group of 5.  Having breakfast at the hotel worked out great as we had 2 4yr old girls with us.  The staff was friendly and always greeted us with a smile.  We also enjoyed the pool one afternoon which was a great break from the parks.  Staying here made the trip so much more affordable and I was able to indulge my family without worrying about cost.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a wonderful review in regards to your stay with us. I am so thrilled to read your positive feedback and sincerely thank you for your 5 star review! I will pass along your positive comments to all of our staff, we look forward to seeing you again during your next visit! Best regards, Ruby

Summary: i had three room for my whole family the staf was  awesome .. The breakfast was really good... Check-in was fast... And  literally minutes from Disneyland... The one and only negative thing I have to say is the parking it's really tight but I would  definitely stay their over and over....
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel in regards to your stay. I am glad to hear of the great service you received and that you would stay with us again. We look forward to having you back here in the future and hope you have another pleasant experience! Best regards, Ruby

Summary: Great experience checking in. She was very friendly and helpful and worried about my luggage as I was on third floor and elevator was out of service. Offered to get me help which I declined and then phoned my room in a while to see if I made it and how was everything. Rooms are large and comfortable and well equipped. I walked to downtown Disney and back first night .the lady servicing breakfasts is very nice and keeps it very clean and well stocked. A great stay
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a beautiful feedback in regards to your stay with us. I am very happy to hear that our hotel received a Grade-A score by you, I will be sure to pass along these comments to our staff so that they know to keep up the great work. We hope your next stay with us will be just as pleasant if not better.

Summary: If you are lkng for a clean, comfortable and quiet stay this is the place. Been here twice and both times the staff were great. From the check in process to their room service & yummy breakfast. all was speedy and efficient. Close to restaurants, major streets and DL! If you do your homework, you will see the price is affordable when compared to other places. Thanks Alfred & Ruby! Sincerely,  The other Alfred and Lisa!
Manager Response: Thank you so much Alfred and Lisa for your outstanding review. Ruby and Alfred were so thrilled about your feedback. Please make us your second home in Anaheim. We hope to see both of you with your family and friends very soon.

Summary: Great choice for families or groups as the rooms are large, plenty of counterspace, and storage, even the fridge is larger than typical hotel room. Beds were very comfortable. It is a quick 3-5 minute drive to main Disney parking. Walking would be probably 30 min and over a freeway overpass. Worth it to drive and pay $17 for parking. Front desk and housekeeping were the kindest most helpful and friendly I've encountered in any hotel. Excellent service. Albert at front desk printed our park tickets for us.  Only con is that the "deluxe continental" breakfast was disappointing. ( waffle bar, cereal,pastries, juice, biscuits and gravy,) A few protein additions like peanut butter, Hard boiled eggs, and raisins for oatmeal would improve the breakfast. Parking was tight and hard to
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review in regards to your stay with us. I am glad to hear that you experienced our excellent service from our front desk and housekeeping staff.  I want you to know that the comments and suggestions we receive from our guests are taken seriously.  They tell us what we're doing right, what we're doing wrong and how we can improve.  Your willingness to share your recent experience is genuinely appreciated. I hope to see you again in the future to provide you with an even better stay than before!

Summary Heading: VERY Disappointed! Filthy Carpets, Uncomfortable Bed and Pillows, Just Cheap!
Summary: Our stay started with a 45 minute wait in the lobby because our room wasn't ready despite a 3pm check-in guarantee. The staff did nothing to accommodate us for this inconvenience, save a feigned, "sorry". To make matters worse during our wait the staff attempted to charge a parking fee in addition to the room charge despite our reservation stating "free parking". The room was haphazardly cleaned and the carpets filthy. We had to wear sandals because walking on the carpet left a gross sticky residue and layers of dirt on our feet. additionally the small cheap pillows and uncomfortable mattresses resulted in a terrible night's sleep and a sore back and neck. One of the beds was noticeable indented from it's use. Perhaps they should replace old furniture and upgrade the pillows.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for taking the time to give us a feedback  regarding your recent stay. Allow me to apologize on behalf of our hotel staff for failing to provide great customer service on your recent visit. I have shared your feedback with the rest of our staff and believe me when I say that this type of incidents will never happen again in our hotel. I have retrained our staff to ensure we handle these types of situations differently in the future. I personally have checked the room to ensure that our housekeeping staff is properly caring for the room and that we are providing a clean and comfortable room to our guests. Again, thank you for your time and valuable feedback. We sincerely appreciate it and hope you will give us another chance to provide you with superior service and accommodations on your next  Anaheim visit . Best regards, Ruby

Summary: I rented two rooms for myself and family,which included two small children. Spacious,clean rooms, very good breakfast and facilities,excellent staff,and good location to Disney Parks. An unusual situation happened, and the staff couldn't have been more professional.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive comments regarding your stay at our hotel! We pride ourselves in great value, especially given our close location to the Disneyland area. I am glad you were satisfied with your stay and we very much look forward to seeing you again during your next Anaheim visit!

Summary Heading: Clean, well-cared for hotel - but watch your wallet
Summary: Overall had a positive experience during my Sunday night stay here, other than the bevy of hidden charges the hotel tried to sneak in on me. My third floor room was clean, decent sized, decently furnished. Everything worked properly and was in a good state of repair. The hotel was a little on the noisy side overnight, mostly families with young children, the hotel is very close to Disney. WiFi was good but not great. I feel like the value was OK for the rate paid. The negatives - the hotel tried to charge me $5.75 to park overnight - basically a hidden charge as far as I am concerned, was not made aware of this until check-in. Also upon check-in I was informed that a pre-authorization for an additional $75 would be taken on my credit card, for "incidentals". The front desk
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review in regards to your stay. On behalf of the hotel, I apologize for failing to completely meet your expectations and can assure you your feedback is taken into account when making improvements to our hotel. I hope on your next Anaheim hotel reservation you can give us a another chance. Please give me a call direct to make it up to you.

Summary: I contacted Quality Inn & Suites to negotiate a block of rooms for our basketball team for an upcoming tournament at the American Sports Center. Penny was absolutely wonderful in helping set up a block of rooms for us in a price range that worked for our team's families and included complimentary hot breakfast and free parking. She treated me like family and was friendly, helpful and courteous. If our stay at the hotel is anything like the process of booking our rooms, then I'm sure we are in for a pleasant stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel in regards to your stay. I am glad to hear of the great service you received and that you would stay with us again. We look forward to having you back here in the future and hope you have another pleasant experience!

Summary Heading: Would give more than a 5 on service if I could
Summary: Accidentally left a jacket behind and the hotel staff was absolutely awesome in helping me get it back - even went as far as directly dropping it off at the Post Office because the postal carrier wouldn't take my return envelope as is with the postage. On top of that, the staff called at least three times to inform me of the steps they were taking and then to confirm I had successfully received my jacket in the mail.
Manager Response: Dear Nate, Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel in regards to your stay. I am glad to hear that you appreciate the great service you received and that you would stay with us again. I am so thrilled to read your positive feedback and sincerely thank you for your 5 star review! I will pass along your positive comments to all of our staff.  We look forward to having you back here in the future and hope you have another great experience! Best regards, Ruby

Summary: We had a wonderful stay for our family trip to Disney. We rode the shuttle a block from Hotel to the front gate and back. We could even see the fireworks perfectly from the hotel balcony. It was also great to have a quick bite to eat with the continental breakfast before heading out to Disney.  Most importantly, we must praise the honesty of housekeeping. We left behind a substantial amount of money, about $400 in the room upon check out. It had fallen out of our pocket under the bed skirt. We didn't realize it until we were almost to Arizona. We phoned the Hotel and they called us in about an hour to tell us they found our cash. It was amazing and our way home 5 days later, we went back and picked it up. Thank you Quality Inn for your honesty and a great stay!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review in regards to your stay. I am so glad to hear your positive feedback and see that you gave us 5 stars, it shows the staff that their hard work, honesty and dedication to our guests experience is paying off. Once again, thank you for your kind comments and we hope to see you again in the future!  Best regards, Ruby

Summary: I recently had a fire at my house and I have been forced to stay in hotels for a couple of weeks due to the rehabilitation efforts.  I was told by the construction workers at my house if you ready on a certain date it was not I had to make the reservations here last minute through website and after booking my stay there were no problems I showed up the night clerk book me in in less than 10 minutes take into account the fact that I didn't have any former state ID only had a passportI requested a king size bed and got it is one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in. The room was spotless plenty of towels refrigerator coffee maker iron and ironing board and there were no people hanging around in the parking lot past dark like other hotels in Anaheim area. I slept in so
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel in regards to your stay. I am glad to hear of the great service you received and that you would stay with us again. We look forward to having you back here in the future and hope you have another pleasant experience!  Best regards, Ruby

Summary Heading: Very good deal for the price
Summary: After a slightly bumpy issue pre stay due to ChoiceHotels.com and not the local facility we had a great stay.  Very good breakfast, would have loved to see some kind of meat, sausage or bacon, maybe blueberry waffle mix available.  Was great to see the Disneyland fireworks from our room.  Don't depend on ART transportation if you have to be somewhere at a certain time as they claim they run every 20-30 minutes, but we waited 45 minutes two different times. We are already planning our next trip to Anaheim and will definitely be looking at this hotel as a prime candidate due to price, quality and location to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Rick, Thank you so much for your wonderful review.  We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and the Disney fireworks view from you room.  We hope to see you again in the future and will be certain to provide you with the same excellent service you.   Best regards, Ruby

Summary: I thought this place would be okay, given all of the good reviews. That said there were a couple of good things like the breakfast and the lobby. First was not told I would have to pay up front for the room and give a $75 deposit and pay for parking. The room itself was not very clean, there were hairs everywhere; the bed, towels and bathroom. The website said it was newly renovated but it seems like they only did the outside and the lobby. The shower was just painted over, the furniture was all scratched up and chipped. I assume they don't pay the maids as the room didn't even look like it had been vacuumed, my sons socks turned black from the carpet. The saying you get what you pay for rings true, I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Please accept our sincere apology. We want you to know that the comments and suggestions we receive from our guests are taken seriously. They tell us what we're doing right, what we're doing wrong and how we can improve.  Your willingness to share your recent experience is genuinely appreciated.  Please be assured that the issues you've raised have been addressed, and the appropriate action has been taken.  Again, we want to thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us. Please give us another chance to serve your future Anaheim hotel needs again.

Summary Heading: No hot tub or free parking.         shuttle?
Summary: excellent facility no complaints at all with the property.  The information from trip advisor  site was not as good.  The listing says free parking that is incorrect they charge 5.50 per day.  If you go directly to quality inn site they say that it is not free.  The picture from this site shows a hot tub.  The pic is NOT from that property, again a failure from the trip advisor website, and not quality Inn.  The shuttle is the bus that only runs once an hour and closes an hour before Disneyland closes. Do not waste your 5.00  each for the shuttle.  Trip advisor site let me down big time.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. Please be assured that the issues you've raised have been addressed, and we will definitely call the attention of Trip Advisor to correct their information about our hotel. Thank you again for your kind words about your last stay with us and to bring to our attention the wrong information that needed to be corrected in Trip Advisor website.

Summary: This hotel was very nice. Clean, and staff was awesome. I left a sweater behind by mistake I called hotel and long story short they had it I talked with Ruby and she was so very very nice to see that I got my sweater back. I will for sure return to this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone. About 15 min walk to Disneyland maingate. Thanks again so much Ruby
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your awesome review Joanna! It is always our pleasure to exceed all the expectations of our guests. We hope to see you and your family real soon.

Summary: I been staying at this hotel since Nov 2014  this is my favorite Quality Inn now  I really like the rooms they have plenty of space  I always get the room with the King Bed and whirlpool inside the bathroom I love it because I get to take a bath and relax  the rooms are very clean and  bed is comfortable also the rooms have more then 1 window they have 1 or 2 smaller ones with shutters is nice because it feels to me like an apartment  The staff there is very nice is you need anything they will make sure to take care of you  Ruby is there in the morning to help you she is very helpful and alfred is there in the evening to help you they both will make sure you have a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much Laura for your outstanding appreciation of our hotel, especially our staff. On behalf of Quality Inn & Suites Anaheim Maingate team, I am writing to let you know how delighted we were to receive your kind words of praise. It's truly rewarding when a guest recognizes our staff’s efforts, and takes the time to say thank you.   Thank you for making us your home away from home. Please always give a call for your next reservations. You know we are always here waiting for you.

Summary: We decided to stay two more days in Anaheim to visit Disneyland on a day that might not be so busy. The night desk person was great. The rooms are nice. The walls are paper thin. Right before midnight, the people in the room next door decided to jiggle the adjoining door between their room and ours and scared the heck out of us. I heard so much noise and couldn't sleep. I told the morning desk person, she unsympathetically gave us a new room. Also, this motel says maingate, but it's not close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your concerns regarding your recent reservation with our hotel. We apologize about the noise of other guests next to your room. I hope you inform the front desk about the noise so that we could immediately call their attention about their disturbance. I am glad that the front desk immediately rectified your concern and offered you to move to different room next day to prevent the issue to occur again.   About our location from Disneyland, we are actually two and a half blocks away from Disneyland maingate or fifteen to twenty minutes walking distance. We also offer the ART Disneyland shuttle service which is less than a minute walk shuttle stops outside of our hotel. The shuttle passes are available in our front desk as well.   Once again, please accept my apology  Hopefully, when visiting this area in the future you'll give us another chance and consider us your hotel of choice again.

Summary: Good value for the price. Within walking distance to main gate of Disneyland. Free breakfast was very good. Lots to choose from. Room was very clean, but on the small size for a family of four. Would stay there again.
Manager Response: On behalf of our hotel staff, I am writing to let you know how delighted we were to receive your kind words of praise. We accommodate many guests each evening, and we strive to make their night's stay a satisfying one.  The principal goal of our hotel is to provide dependable service to all of our guests at reasonable prices.  But, it's only through their eyes that we can accurately assess the quality of the accommodations and services we provide.  Again, let me thank you for your kind words.  We're committed to total guest satisfaction, and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great place, but my feelings are mixed...
Summary: I stayed here for almost a week on business.  The staff was fantastic, from the front desk to the maids, they were nice and pleasant and helpful when needed.  The grounds are kept beautifully and the place is just overall well maintained.  No problems there.   The suite is stayed in was HUGE.  No problems there as far as size... Decor, I'll get to in a minute.  One huge plus is on the weekend evenings I had a great view of the fireworks at Disney... I mean, truly a great little pleasure!   My only problems with this place are simply based upon personal preference.  For example, Had I known this was a hotel with rooms facing the outside (rather than hallways on the inside), I probably wouldn't have stayed here in the first place.  I just prefer my windows to be facing away from
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your awesome review. On behalf of our hotel staff, we want to let you know how delighted we were to receive your kind words of praise to our staff, how well maintained and beautiful our hotel and the perfect view of Disneyland fireworks from your room. Your recommendation to your family and friends will be highly appreciated. We hope to see more of you.

Summary: One of those rare occasion when one have the good fortune of meeting an employee  who is willing to provide excellent service. We met one - Arcee at the front desk. We arrived before check in time, he made extra effort to get us the room type that we requested. Next morning, we found our car being boxed in on both sides and could not even get into the car from either side. Arcee went out twice to find one of the car owner to move their vehicle so that we could back out.  The hotel itself is OK, older, but spacious and clean.  Not a good stay (not the fault of the hotel) - aside from the parking incidence, at 2am, kids were screaming and yelling for an hour, then some guest(s) constantly used his/her annoying beeping remote car control. Wish people have some consideration and
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience about your last stay with us. It always made us feel so good when our guests like you really appreciate our customer service and especially the effort of each staff. A huge thank you from Arcee with a big smile. You really made his day. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: we only stayed the 1 night, the reception staff seemed genuinely happy to see us. The room was large, plenty of pillows and towels. The free continental breakfast was well presented. Lots of parking and my favourite a guest laundry.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback. We are so please to hear that you had a very pleasant stay with us. We accommodate many guests each evening, and we strive to make their night's stay a satisfying one. The principal goal of our hotel is to provide the best customer service to all of our guests.  But, it's only through the eyes of our guests like you, that we can accurately assess the quality of the accommodations and services we provide. Again, thank you so much and please see us more often.

Summary: This hotel was very convenient and close to Disneyland. No need to pay for parking because it only took us about 8 min to walk. People were very friendly and the beds were comfortable. Our family enjoyed our stay here. Very relaxing for the most part. We definitely plan to stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review. We are so glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. Especially when you mentioned the convenience of our location from Disneyland, our staff friendliness to provide you the best customer service and the comfort of our beds. We all love the review title you gave us, "Great Hotel for Disneyland". Again, let me thank you for your kind words.  We're committed to total guest satisfaction, and we look forward to your next visit very soon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and so close to Disneyland and LA Angels stadium...
Summary: Book on line 2 days before arriving.  Very pleased with room, bit dated but had all we needed.  Comfortable king bed, good internet and a big variety of breakfast (included in room rate). Staff very friendly and helpful.  Location was great for the LA Angels stadium (5 - 10 mins by car depending on traffic) and main entrance to Disneyland only 3 blocks away (could walk but we took car - parking was very smooth and shuttle trams from car park to main gate was quick and easy.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your beautiful review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are also happy to hear you appreciate our location from Disneyland and Anaheim Angels stadium. Thank you again for your kind comments as we look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary: This newly upgraded and renovated hotel is a great deal. Their rooms are spacious, clean, and the beds are so comfortable. The location is quiet and perfect distance from Disneyland because it's just 20 minutes walk. Although on our third day we decided to use the ART shuttle. Their hot breakfast was the added plus. All the staff were amazing but we want to emphasize to the outstanding helpfulness of Ruby. She is everybody's favorite. She was always with a big smile every time we see her. She is my dream employee to have in my own business.
Manager Response: Massive thank you for your fabulous review. We want you to know that you made us feel so good reading your review. We always value all our guests especially those who knows how to appreciate and share all our hard work. Please be assured that Quality Inn & Suites Maingate is always here to provide you the best hotel experience. We hope to see more of you and thank you so much again.

Summary: Impressed with the renovations!! The beds are always comfortable and finally updated the room and the breakfast! ! Alfred, who had checked us in,  was the friendliest employee I have encountered at any hotel for a long time.  His hospitality really showed throughout our check in process and i loved that he called our room to make sure everything was perfect. I would definitely bring my family here again!!! Absolutely enjoyed my stay! !
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. We will share your review to whole team of Quality Inn & Suites  Maingate.

Summary: My husband and two daughters were very pleased with our stay.  The rooms have been recently updated so were fresh-looking and clean.   Due to a late booking, we had a king bed with pull-out couch.  The bed was very comfortable but the pull-out couch - not so much.  That said, my young daughters had no problem sleeping on the pull-out.  We enjoyed a very nice breakfast (waffles, cereal, pastries, english muffins, toast, oatmeal, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs (these were okay), juice, and coffee) both mornings of our stay.
